info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 13 at 5:42AM MST until December 14 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...PLAINS BLIZZARD TODAY THROUGH TONIGHT... .A strong winter storm system will produce blizzard conditions over northeastern Colorado today through tonight. Strong winds are expected to gust up to 60 mph. The heaviest snow is expected to be on the plains east of Greeley and Denver, focusing toward the Akron, Sterling, Fort Morgan and Limon areas. If you are planning travel northeast, east or southeast of Denver today, you should consider changing your plans to avoid travel. Travel will be difficult to impossible and road closures are likely. Those with outdoor livestock interests should prepare now for blizzard conditions. Continued cold and very windy weather will continue behind the storm Wednesday into Thursday. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow ongoing. Additional snow accumulations up to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Rabbit Ears Pass, Rocky Mountain National Park and the Medicine Bow Range, and The Mountains of Summit County, the Mosquito Range, and the Indian Peaks. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Roads will likely become slick and hazardous. Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday morning and evening commutes. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org. Chain and traction laws will possibly be enacted for the mountains. If traveling to the mountains, be prepared for winter driving conditions.
